description.narrative: The equality in action program (Volunteer Cooperation program) is a global capacity building program for local partner organizations delivered mainly through Canadian volunteers and other mechanisms. The program aims to increase the social and economic well beingof the poorest, most marginalized people, especially women and girls. This should be achieved by increasing partners' performance from 13 countries in implementing more inclusive, innovative and sustainable development initiatives that advancegender equality and inclusive governance. Additionally, the program will increase Canadians participation in international development and key global issues by supporting gender equality, empowerment of women and girls, and inclusive governance through working closely with partnersand supporting their needs and capacities. Through this programme and initiative , SHAMS will train a group of 43 election monitorsto Strengthen Palestinian women's political participation and influence political agendas to be more gender sensitive : This training will take place over two days and will total 15 hours of training. The group will be trained in political participation and skills related to the election monitoring process.

participating-org.narrative: “SHAMS” Center believes that dissemination and generalization of human rights should be tackled ‎from a holistic approach that takes into consideration the civil, political, economic, social and cultural ‎rights, and their mutual interdependence on each other.‎ Shams aims mainly at providing capacity building to organizations and individuals (especially women ‎and youth) in the fields of human rights and democratic participation.‎ 1. Dissemination of information about human rights, democracy, and good governance issues ‎through the utilization of the media 2. Promotion of the concepts of human rights in Palestinian legislation. 3. Strengthening the role of women within their communities 4. Strengthening the role of youth and more generally promotingvolunteerism in Palestine. 5. Capacity building and strengthening the relationship and cooperation between local, regional ‎and international institutions. 6. Compilation and publication of research and studies. 7. Promoting change within society, especially countering stereotypes and biases towards ‎women, increasing values of tolerance, and awareness of democratic principles and ‎participation. 8. Empower target groups to be able to demand and defend their needs and rights.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands
